question:
With regards to the recent initiative to allow Divyangs to perform Bhasma Aarti at the Mahakaleshwar Temple, consider the following statements:
  1. The temple is located in Maharashtra.
  2. It is one of the 12 Jyotirlinga in India.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Mahakaleshwar temple is located in Ujjain in Madhya Pradesh. It is located on the bank of River Shipra. The temple had recently made provisions to enable Divyangs to perform Bhasma Aarti in light of the Makar Sankranti celebrations. Statement 2 is correct:       The Mahakaleshwar temple is one of the 12 Jyotirlinga shrines in India. These are considered as the holiest abodes of Lord Shiva. Another such shrine in Madhya Pradesh is the Omkareshwar Temple in Khandwa. The Mahakaleshwar Temple had earlier received the Divyanga Friendly Temple Award.
